Temporary thread for three-monster Combination Attacks
Monster Rancher Metropolis: Monster Rancher 4 Archive (PS2): Miscellaneous Q&A (Post New Questions Here) : Temporary thread for three-monster Combination Attacks
By Volafor on Tuesday, May 22, 2007 - 05:52 pm:

Thank you, Lisa, for prompting me to restart this thread. I'm quite new on these boards, and anxious not to step on any administrative toes, so to speak.

In certain major battles in Adventure Mode (i.e., against the Raiden in Togle Caves), all three monsters can team up for a combination attack.
My observations:
1. The combination attack is catalyzed by the monster in the front line of the battle. The attack each monster may use is determined by its main breed; each breed has a unique special attack, regardless of sub-breed.
To illustrate: suppose that your adventure party consisted of a Garu, a Mew and a Beaklon. Taken individually, each monster may use only one unique attack, determined by its main breed. However, since three different breeds of monster are present, there is the possibility of three different combination attacks, dependent upon which monster you place in the front line.

2. I have noticed that, if the lead monster is Composed, the other monsters will volunteer more readily for the three-monster combinations. Likewise, if the monster in the lead is stressed, there is a smaller chance that the other monsters will volunteer for the team up. I am unsure whether friendship has any effect on this; I haven't tested it.

3. So far, each time I have used a three-monster combination attack, it has emptied out my Guts meter. I'm not sure whether or not that holds true for all the three-monster combination attacks, however; I haven't tested every breed yet.

I know that some breeds are already posted elsewhere in the forum, so I will not list them again here. Those who wish to post should consult the archives, where the information already posted is stored. That way there isn't any repeat posting going on.

Combination attacks by breed (listed in the following format):
Breed Name - Attack Name - Effect

I'll start with this one.

1. Mew - Innocent Bomb - Deals Physical attack damage to the target.

By AlmostUnsane on Saturday, January 10, 2009 - 01:38 pm:

Lesione - Grace Wave - Fully restores any missing Life from all three controlled monsters (unsure of effects on KO'd). Takes all guts from each monster.

By Lisa Shock on Saturday, January 10, 2009 - 07:14 pm:

Thanks!

By AlmostUnsane on Saturday, January 17, 2009 - 02:57 pm:

Baku - Break Charge - Baku attacks enemy, followed by both teammates. Baku then follows up with a full-on running tackle against the enemy. Costs all guts from each monster.
